summary: Motorcycle club app for Reapers Asylum MC

existing_features.title: Create a homepage that showcases the Reapers Asylum MC motorcycle club with sections for club overview, mission statement, and featured content
Implement a members roster page that displays club members with their roles (President, Vice President, Road Captain, Secretary, Members, etc.)
Create an events calendar feature where club members can view upcoming rides, meetings, and club events
Implement user authentication using Internet Identity so members can log in and access member-only features
Create a club news feed where administrators can post announcements and updates visible to all members
Implement a photo gallery section for club ride photos and event memories

Design a bold, edgy visual theme inspired by motorcycle club aesthetics with dark colors, leather textures, metallic accents, and rugged typography that reflects the brotherhood and rebellious spirit of a motorcycle club, consistently applied across all pages

Create an admin management interface accessible only to existing admins where they can view current admins, add new admin principals by entering their principal ID, and remove admin privileges from existing admins
Display the currently authenticated user's principal ID on their profile or in a settings area so users can share their principal ID to request admin access
Add visual indicators throughout the application showing when a user is logged in with admin privileges, such as an admin badge in the navbar or profile area
Update the frontend profile setup flow to inform the user if they have been automatically granted admin privileges during their first login
Create an admin-only Member Management page with a form to add new members, requiring fields for name and role, with optional fields for photo URL and bio
Add an edit interface to the Member Management page displaying all current members with edit and delete buttons for each member
Add a role selector dropdown to the member add and edit forms with predefined roles: President, Vice President, Road Captain, Secretary, Sergeant at Arms, Treasurer, and Member
Add a navigation link to the Member Management page in the navbar, visible only to admin users
Update the Members roster page to dynamically display members from the backend instead of using a static list, showing member name, role, photo, and bio when available
Update the Navbar component to use the new Reapers Asylum MC logo image instead of the current placeholder
Update the HomePage hero section to feature the new Reapers Asylum MC logo as the primary visual element

Debug and fix the logo image display issue by verifying the image file exists at frontend/public/assets/generated/reapers-asylum-logo.png, checking that the image path references in Navbar.tsx and HomePage.tsx are correct, and ensuring the image is being properly served as a static asset
If the logo image file is missing from frontend/public/assets/generated/, regenerate it and ensure it is properly copied to the public assets directory during the build process

Update the role selector dropdown in the Member Management page to include all standard motorcycle club ranks: President, Vice President, Road Captain, Secretary, Sergeant at Arms, Treasurer, Enforcer, Tail Gunner, Chaplain, Prospect, and Member

Update the Members roster page role icons and badges to visually represent all motorcycle club ranks with appropriate icons: President (crown), Vice President (star), Road Captain (compass), Secretary (clipboard), Sergeant at Arms (shield), Treasurer (dollar sign), Enforcer (fist), Tail Gunner (shield-check), Chaplain (heart), Prospect (user-plus), and Member (user)
Update the Member Management page role icons to match the expanded set of motorcycle club ranks, ensuring visual consistency with the Members roster page

Create React Query hooks for submitting membership applications (useSubmitApplication), fetching pending applications (usePendingApplications), approving applications (useApproveApplication), and rejecting applications (useRejectApplication)

Add a 'Membership Applications' section to the Admin Management page that displays all pending applications in a card or table format, showing applicant name, bio, submission date, and action buttons to approve or reject each application
Create a membership application submission form accessible to authenticated non-member users, allowing them to enter their name and bio and submit an application to join the club
Create React Query hook useSubmitApplication for submitting membership applications with name and bio
Create React Query hook usePendingApplications for fetching all pending membership applications
Create React Query hook useApproveApplication for approving membership applications
Create React Query hook useRejectApplication for rejecting membership applications
Add Membership Applications section to AdminManagementPage displaying all pending applications with applicant name, bio, submission date, and approve/reject action buttons
Create membership application submission form accessible to authenticated non-member users allowing them to enter name and bio and submit an application
Debug and fix the AdminManagementPage component to ensure the Membership Applications section correctly displays all pending applications retrieved from the usePendingApplications hook
Verify that the usePendingApplications React Query hook is correctly calling the backend getPendingApplications() function and returning the data in the expected format

Add console logging or debug output to trace the data flow from backend getPendingApplications through the usePendingApplications hook to the AdminManagementPage render to identify where the display issue occurs

Investigate and fix the data flow issue preventing pending membership applications from displaying in the AdminManagementPage, ensuring that submitted applications appear in the admin panel's Membership Applications section
Add error handling and user feedback to the AdminManagementPage Membership Applications section to display meaningful messages when no applications are found or when fetch errors occur

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement admin role detection and management
Add backend functionality to designate specific principal IDs as administrators, allowing the owner to set themselves and other trusted members as admins
Make the first logged-in user automatically an admin
Modify the backend to automatically grant admin privileges to the first user who logs in and creates a profile, ensuring that at least one admin always exists in the system
Build a member management interface for admins to add, edit, remove members and assign roles
Create backend functions to add new members with fields for name, role, photo URL, and optional bio, accessible only to admin users
Create backend functions to update existing member information including name, role, photo URL, and bio, accessible only to admin users
Create backend function to delete members from the roster, accessible only to admin users
Update the member roles to include all standard motorcycle club ranks

Expand the backend Member type's role field to support all standard motorcycle club ranks: President, Vice President, Road Captain, Secretary, Sergeant at Arms, Treasurer, Enforcer, Tail Gunner, Chaplain, Prospect, and Member
Create an admin interface to review and approve membership applications
Create a backend data model for membership applications that stores applicant name, bio, application timestamp, and application status (pending, approved, rejected)
Implement backend functions for authenticated users to submit membership applications by providing their name and bio
Implement backend admin-only functions to retrieve all pending membership applications, approve applications (which creates a member with 'Prospect' role), and reject applications
Implement backend data model for membership applications storing applicant principal, name, bio, application timestamp (nanoseconds), and application status (pending, approved, rejected)
Implement backend function for authenticated users to submit membership applications by providing their name and bio
Implement backend admin-only function to retrieve all pending membership applications
Implement backend admin-only function to approve membership applications which creates a member with 'Prospect' role
Implement backend admin-only function to reject membership applications
Verify that the backend getPendingApplications() function correctly retrieves all membership applications with status 'pending' and returns them in the correct format
Verify that the backend getPendingApplications() function returns applications in the correct format expected by the frontend usePendingApplications hook
